reviews.review_msg: Robyn is such a kind person, and a really fair grader. I've been keeping an eye out for her to be teaching other undergrad courses as I really enjoyed her teaching style, but I think she has moved on to mostly PDP courses. Don't hesitate to take a course with her if the opportunity arises. One of the best!

Robyn is one of the best teachers Ive had so far, and Im fourth year. I think she might be a sessional instructor, but if you manage to get a class with her you will be thankful you did. Her lectures are interesting and informative, her homework is easy, shes a fair marker, a great teacher.

The course follows the text so the readings are key - do not fall behind or you'lll get lost in the class discussions. Lots of different activities keeps you awake - videos, group discussion, lecture, real world examples. Very relevant to how education is really practised. Good for teachers and psych majors.

Not a bad class to take online, I just didn't find it that interesting. Fairly straight forward, a few discussions, two papers and a final. Need to read the text. I found the marking was tougher, but the feedback was thoughtful.

Took the class online, Prof was completely absent and had absolutely no contact with students. Class is facilitated by two TA markers. My TA was bad at responding to questions, sometimes not really answering the questions and sometimes providing responses that were nonsensical... but marked really easy. I heard the other TA marked harder.

Took the class online in DE.  TA was not clear as to her expectations and claimed plagiarism even when that did not happen. The TA appeared to be running the show and Lucy was nowhere to be found. She did not address the class a single time. I essentially paid for a course to be taught by a sub-par graduate student. Not acceptable. Discussions imp.

I took EDUC 322 online and found the experience mediocre, if not forgettable. The TA is a fastidious marker (ie. giving .6/1) and does not really provide clear-cut instructions which is a bit of an annoyance. If given the choice, I would not take this class nor recommend it.  It is similar to PSYC children's development, take that instead.

Lucy is one of the best profs I've had. She really applies the concepts she is teaching to her own teaching style. Very clear and to the point. I love how this class was so straightforward. Even though there are weekly readings and written summaries I never felt stressed out. Most of class is discussions and if you pay attention you should do well.

If you show up to class and take notes, you'll definitely get a good mark. The vocabulary she uses is very simple to understand, it's like she cuts everything up into bite-sized pieces for you. I really recommend taking this class in person instead of online if you can.
Easy distance ed course. Four short discussions and two papers all marked very easy. The final was all multiple choice and only worth 35% so an A is attainable regardless of how you do on the exam.

Interesting class. I took it DE and Lucy never once spoke to the class. Even to say hello. The entire class was facilitated by the TM's who were nice enough. One didn't know the correct usage of a semicolon... problematic and no one to talk to about it. Exam was hard and chapters were on it that weren't on the outline. Unsettling! took them off tho
Class focuses on online discussions. Papers are straight forward and easy. Only the MC final exam brought my mark down. I'd only ask for the canvas site to be easier to navigate. Overall, good class.

Hugely reliant on class discussion. You only get one mark back the whole semester (the midterm) and the rest is a mystery. Very nice prof, though and very knowledgeable on the subjects that are covered. When she is lecturing, lectures are very interesting.
easy course, doesn't give back your paper, friendly
Taking this DE. Pretty straight-forward & an easy class to get through; the requirements are split up evenly so as long as you do your work steadily throughout the semester you'll do fine :)

Karen is such a kind and incredible professor. She is not only super smart, but always willing to help those who need it! Talk to her if you're struggling; she is very accomodating if you communicate with her and show that you're actually trying.

The course itself is not difficult to get an A in. That being said, Jessica seemed to get annoyed by small mistakes. If we mess formatting up, she picks on it. Larger mistakes were pointed out by her too, it felt like I was belittled by her. The course is very interesting, but I wouldn't take a course w/ her again.
The course is extremely easy but she does not know how to teach. She discusses basic things in the class and expects you to write the most perfect assignments.

I took EDUC322 online, and it appears my experience was very different from other commenters here. The class was an easy A: three 500 word papers, quizzes every module, and then a final project that you hand in a draft of first so you can get feedback. She provided a free textbook that she wrote herself. I found the content easy and interesting.
I trusted other students' compliments regarding her teaching. Now I regret it. This course has been the worst for me as a 4th year student.

DON'T TAKE this course with her, she is awful. She doesn't have clear rubric for assignments. She picks on silly things and deducts a huge percentage. Contents are easy but her marking makes you doubt your writing ability. If you ask for clear direction, she won't give helpful answers. Her feedback in one assignment isn't useful for the next one.

If you've taken any educational or developmental psych classes before, this class is a breeze -- almost no new concepts. I found that boring, but I guess an A is an A. Relies a LOT on group discussions (like, half the class time) and also includes a group presentation, so if you're shy, avoid. Classes almost always end about an hour early.

Jessica is a lovely professor who is passionate about teaching. The course content was extremely valuable to me and the grading criteria was clear. If you plan to take Educ 322 note that she pays close attention to the rubric/assignment outline when grading. Make sure you check your work to see if all the components are done properly.
Laid Back, Easy Going, Funny. A Great Teacher.

such a sweetheart! choice of midterm paper or group presentation- do the presentation if you can, better chance of higher marks! quizzes are easy & straight from the text, they count for attendance too. final is all written but easy. she is perfect!!!!! really engages with her students & encourages discussion, but it's natural & fun!
